page.title: 19Menwith U.K. - Kettlesing
page.content: During its 25-year existence, Men- with Hill Station has blended into the local community, both physically and socially, being a valuable source of local employment for the surrounding villages, e.g., catering staff, build- ing work and casual labour. Security at the base is administered by M.O.D. police who live within the local area, along with a number of specialist British personnel resident outside the station. Many U.S. families also choose to live outside the base, their children often attending local schools. They are encouraged to participate fully in local entertainment and activities, e.g., Rotary, Red Cross, local charities, etc. The U.S. government contributes to county government in lieu of rates and receives local services.
